oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Burmese nobleman from far-off India in Bright Hall!
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Textual document announces appearance of a Burmese nobleman in a program at Bright Hall open to both adults and children. Admission is being charged for this event.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Announcements; Handbills; Fliers (printed matter)
Broadsides; India; Burma; Lectures and lecturing
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wallace and Sons
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This broadside reflects a popular fascination with the exotic that was intensified by the British annexation of Burma in the 1880s. Tensions had been growing between Britain and Burma since the 1840s, and the issues of multiple sovereignty in the region had created further relationship difficulties. Britain's interests in the security of India and in Burma's raw materials and trade potential were factors that led to the establishment of British colonial authority in Burma in the 1880s.
